name: A room in Pasolini's house
description:
Simple, cozy and silent room in a lived house (me and eventual other guest or a friend); location of the house is central and offers great food, museums and green places.
The room is equipped with secretary, chair, closet, night table, a double bed. Furniture could be different from pictures. No locker. Kitchen (available just for breakfast) and bathroom are shared and must be kept clean.
I request you to read the rules of the house before booking and to strictly respect them all over the stay.
neighborhood_overview:
In the very nearby you have Via Saragozza and San Luca walking (UNESCO heritage) which is the 666 arches longest portico of the world, leading you to Santuario di San Luca; San Francesco Church with the Glossatori Tombs; the Collegio di Spagna with his beautiful portale; and Via del Pratello, famous street with a lot of bars, pubs and nightlife. The principal Bologna square, Piazza Maggiore, and all the main monuments are in a range of 10-15 minutes walking distance - Bologna historical center inside the walls is 45 minutes from wall to wall. You will be in the heart of the city!
Train station is 20 minutes walking away, airport 25 minutes away by taxi or about an hour with public transportation.
host_about:
I am an actress, a yoga student and teacher, a mother, a coffee addicted foodwinebeermankind lover and much more.
I am an upfront but hands off host. I really like to travel and I am passionate about cultures and countries, so I am happy to know more about my guests, but I also want to respect them and their personalities and make them feel at ease, so the first thing I do is smiling!
If I have time, it's a pleasure for me to hang out with the people I host; if not, anyway I do my best for them making themselves home, having a good time and making the most in amazing Bologna.
I am not perfect, my house's not perfect too! I decided to open the door to travellers to offer a different and genuine home stay, the good the bad and the weird.
If you are looking for a hotel standard maybe this is not the right accomodation for you. If you are that type of guest who feels the need to find every possible reason to report or complain about, please, stay elsewhere :) I really don't feel the urge to rate you as a guest, we are all humans raised in different environments and I think tolerance and acceptance of diversity is more important than rules. So please, if you book, don't feel the urge to rate me as a host as well, especially because I do everything by myself, from taking care of the house to the cleaning/washing, from communication to welcoming...a hard job and a lot of responsibility!
If you like me strongly believe in human beings, and find interesting to get in contact with people raised in different cultures, I'll be very happy to host you in my place, and the best review I could receive is if you feel home!

name: AmaBologna B&B Double Room
neighborhood_overview:
Wikipedia:
The Porta Saragozza of Bologna was one of the gates or portals in the medieval walls of this city.

The gate was built in the 13-14th centuries, and by 1334 it was provided with a drawbridge crossing a moat. It was not used much until 1674, when the long Portico di San Luca was built from the center of town to the Basilica della Beata Vergine di San Luca, used in yearly procession of an icon. From then on it became also known as the ‚ÄúPorta Sacra‚Äù or the ‚ÄúPorta dei pellegrini‚Äù (Holy Gate and Gate of Pilgrims) for its placement in the route towards the Sanctuary of San Luca.

In 1859, concordant with a rising movement to restore medieval remnants in Italian cities, the architect Giuseppe Mengoli, replaced the mediaeval cassero with the present one by connecting it with two crenellated arches to the two lateral cylindrical great towers, giving it its present castle-like form.[1]

About nine of the original twelve gates remain in the third set

name: I 4 GATTI Guesthouse. Room 6, Quadruple 2¬∞ floor
description: 4 Gatti is a guesthouse nestled within an enchanting old villa, boasting six rooms and surrounded by lush gardens. Situated in the picturesque residential neighborhood of via Audinot in Bologna, it offers tranquility and greenery while remaining conveniently close to the city center. By booking one of our private rooms, you gain access to our shared garden and common areas on the first floor, providing opportunities to relax and socialize with fellow guests
neighborhood_overview:
Audinot street is a beautiful boulevard full of old villas with garden in liberty style. Birds are cirping and the city traffic seems far.
We are located in the suburb of porta saragozza, 15 minutes of walk from the center, comfortably reachable from the train station with bus 33.
Along street Saragozza you can find many bars and pastry shops, a bank, a supermarket and many fruits and vegetables shops. From here starts the porch of S.Luca, with more than 650 arcades goes all the way to the top of the hill to the monastery dedicated to the virgin Mary. Throug this arcade (the longest in the world) pass the ‚Äúway of the gods‚Äù, a trekking that goes from Bologna to Florence along the mountains between Emilia Romagna and Tuscany.
host_about: Mi chiamo Filippo e sono nato a Bologna. Amo viaggiare e visto i pochi ostelli presenti a Bologna mi sono deciso ad aprirne uno mio nella vecchia casa di famiglia, sistemandola per ospitare viaggiatori e studenti che vogliono godersi questi bellissima piccola citt√†. Mi piace creare una bella atmosfera in casa e sono sempre disponibile con aiuti e suggerimenti a rendere il vostro soggiorno il pi√π piacevole possibile. Mi piace molto scrivere, il cinema, la musica, i fumetti e spesso sono in giro per i numerosi eventi che Bologna offre su questi argomenti. Amo l'Australia, il mare, pescare, le montagne e lo snowboard.

description:
Convenient and comfortable accommodation just close to the center of Bologna.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is tiny but very cozy and welcoming, in a quiet position and convenient to reach the central train station, the city center with the University, Fiera District (MOTOR SHOW, COSMOPROF, LINEA PELLE, SANA, SAIE ‚Ä¶), The Palazzo dei Congressi and Europaditorium Theatre
host_about:
Ciao! Sono Sara, vivo a Bologna ma sono originaria di Lecce. Viaggiare √® una delle attivit√† che mi appassiona di pi√π e per cui riesco a sacrificare molte cose che reputo non essenziali, per me viaggiare significa ampliare l'esperienza di vita, maturare uno sguardo pi√π libero e profondo su me e sul mondo, nello stesso tempo mi fa ritornare bambina perch√® mi predispongo alla conoscenza del nuovo con la curiosit√† e l' entusiasmo che forse nella routine quotidiana mi √® venuta a mancare! Quando non viaggio......cerco di ritagliarmi lo stesso degli spazi in cui la mia mente pu√≤ continuare a farlo, almeno metaforicamente, tramite i libri, la musica, il cinema che adoro!!! Queste cose mi aiutano a sentirmi viva, a percepirmi nella mia essenza pi√π autentica, e chiaro, quando riesco a condividere tutto ci√≤ con una o pi√π persone che incontro lungo il cammino, l'esperienza diventa ancora pi√π bella e interessante!
L'ospitalit√†, la cordialit√† e la disponibilit√† alla conoscenza sono caratteristiche che amo nelle persone e che fanno parte del mio modo d'essere. La condivisione espande l'esperienza di vita e arricchisce lo spirito! Benvenuta gente!

name: A room in Pasolini's house 2
description:
Small, cozy and silent room in a lived house (me and eventual other guests); location of the house is central and offers great food, museums and green places.
The room is equipped with queen size bed, night table, open wardrobe, secretary and chair. No locker. Furniture could be different from pictures.
Kitchen (available just for breakfast) and bathroom are shared, and must be kept clean.
I request you to read the rules of the house before booking and to strictly respect them all over the stay.
neighborhood_overview:
In the very nearby you have Via Saragozza and San Luca walking (UNESCO heritage) which is the 666 arches longest portico of the world, leading you to Santuario di San Luca; San Francesco Church with the Glossatori Tombs; the Collegio di Spagna with his beautiful portale; and Via del Pratello, famous street with a lot of bars, pubs and nightlife. The principal Bologna square, Piazza Maggiore, and all the main monuments are in a range of 10-15 minutes walking distance - Bologna historical center inside the walls is 45 minutes from wall to wall. You will be in the heart of the city!
Train station distance is around 20 minutes walking, airport 25 minutes by taxi or about an hour by public transportation.
host_about:
I am an actress, a yoga student and teacher, a mother, a coffee addicted foodwinebeermankind lover and much more.
I am an upfront but hands off host. I really like to travel and I am passionate about cultures and countries, so I am happy to know more about my guests, but I also want to respect them and their personalities and make them feel at ease, so the first thing I do is smiling!
If I have time, it's a pleasure for me to hang out with the people I host; if not, anyway I do my best for them making themselves home, having a good time and making the most in amazing Bologna.
I am not perfect, my house's not perfect too! I decided to open the door to travellers to offer a different and genuine home stay, the good the bad and the weird.
If you are looking for a hotel standard maybe this is not the right accomodation for you. If you are that type of guest who feels the need to find every possible reason to report or complain about, please, stay elsewhere :) I really don't feel the urge to rate you as a guest, we are all humans raised in different environments and I think tolerance and acceptance of diversity is more important than rules. So please, if you book, don't feel the urge to rate me as a host as well, especially because I do everything by myself, from taking care of the house to the cleaning/washing, from communication to welcoming...a hard job and a lot of responsibility!
If you like me strongly believe in human beings, and find interesting to get in contact with people raised in different cultures, I'll be very happy to host you in my place, and the best review I could receive is if you feel home!

description:
In the heart of Bologna, in a charming 18th-century Palazzo Storico, Viviana and Flavio will welcome you in a charming apartment with a large bright room with the possibility of independent entrance.

Behind Piazza Maggiore, less than 1 km from the Central Station and the Autostation and a few minutes' walk from the main monuments, squares and museums, it is the ideal place for those who want to discover the city on foot.

The neighborhood, very central, is full of shops, restaurants, cafes, clubs, cinemas and theaters. It is also well connected to the outlying areas: the stop of line 28 for the Fair is only 200 meters away and the airport shuttle is 300 meters away.

In our house you will find:

- Furnished room with double bed with the possibility of independent access

- Living room with sofa, TV, Internet, bookshelf and music selected with turntable

- Bathroom equipped with linens, hairdryer and flat flat

name: "Behind Lumier√©" Big & Sunny room in Art District
description:
Please take two minutes of your time to read entirely the description, thank you!

A beautiful double room, only 5 minutes walking from Via dell'Indipendenza, is available for rent. A nice Italian breakfast is included in the price :)
There is also a SINGLE BED FOR THE THIRD PERSON AND IS POSSIBLE ADDING ANOTHER ONE IN CASE YOU ARE FOUR.

CHECK IN FROM 12AM UNTIL 10PM, IF ANYONE NEED DIFFERENT TIME HAVE TO CONCORDE BEFORE
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located on Via Lame 57, in the exact center of the artery that connects Piazza Malpighi, the capital of many bus lines, and Porta Lame, one of the 12 access gates to the city inside the old walls.
The neighborhood is one of the historic neighborhoods of Bologna, which is experiencing a new youth thanks to the renovated Mercato delle Erbe, the beautiful Via del Pratello, the Lumiere cinema and many other attractions such as the Museum of Modern Art "MAMBO".

A few minutes walk away is Via Zaragoza with 666 arches (the longest portico in the world), which leads to the Sanctuary of San Luca; the Church of San Francesco with the tombs of the Glossatori; the College of Spain with its beautiful portal; and Via del Pratello, a famous street with lots of bars, taverns and jazzclubs.
Bologna's main square: Piazza Maggiore, with the church of San Petronio and the newly restored Neptune statue and all the main monuments are within a 10 minute walk.

energy-efficient wooden house located on the liveliest pedestrian street in Bologna's old town. Single room with the possibility of adding a single bed; private bathroom in the room. The B&B has another two double bedrooms with bathroom and a shared kitchen.
Breakfast served in one of the two affiliated bars, free WiFi, terrace and large common living room.
neighborhood_overview: The street is full of pubs, breweries, restaurants of all kinds. It is pedestrian and especially in the evening it fills with students. It's a very safe road.
host_about: Sono Anna, ho un  B&B recentemente costruito in legno con tecnologie ad alta prestazione energetica.

name: Ca' del Genio: camera con vista
description: 5 min by car from the 2 towers, the room offers  an incredible taste of the countryside, all comfort and a breathtaking view.
neighborhood_overview: The cool hills are a favourite place of the locals during the warm bolognese summer.
host_about:
Sono un viticoltore che si occupa anche di giardini, api, produzione di ortaggi, enologia e arte culinaria! Dopo il Liceo ho trascorso diversi anni in Francia, dove ho frequentato corsi di alta formazione di  cucina, viticoltura, enologia. Ho poi lavorato in Borgogna come tecnico della vigna e consulente presso famose aziende viticole. Sono ritornato in Italia per amore, con il progetto di piantare una vigna tutta mia per poterne un giorno assaporare i frutti! Anche questo rappresenta il podere di Ca' del Genio, per me, mia moglie Marta e le nostre bimbe Irene e Nora.

I‚Äôm Lorenzo, I am a viticulturist but I am also involved in gardening, apiculture, vegetable production, wine and culinary art! After high school I spent several years in France, where I attended advanced training courses in cooking, viticulture, enology. I then worked in Burgundy vineyards as technical consultant for famous wine estates. I came back to Italy for love, with the dream to plant a vineyard my own, for one day enjoy its fruits! This is what also represents the estate of Ca' del Genio for me and for my wife Marta and our daughters Irene and Nora

Double/Triple room with queen size bed+sofa (or queen size+single bed) with private bathroom, tv led 32", air cond, fridge, safe, amenities. The room is illuminated by skylights.
Please be aware that for 2 persons will be made up only the queen size bed.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet but offers a lot in terms of attractions and services. We are in the historical center of Bologna, so in close proximity you can find restaurants, cinemas, supermarket, pharmacies and any kind of shopping venues. The train station is a 10 minute walk away; from there you can get to Florence in 35 minutes, Milan in 1 hour, or Rome in 2 hours via high speed trains. name: QUIET LOVELY ROOM IN THE HEART OF BOLOGNA
description:
My name is Matteo and I am pleased to welcome you to the heart of Bologna !! I love learning about cultures from the world!
I offer a very nice single room, large (30m2), quiet and bright. Furnished room, affordable in the historic center of Bologna in a completely renovated apartment.
The exceptional and exclusive location allows you to walk to all the main points of interest in the historic center in a few minutes. I can gladly show you typical areas, restaurants, attractions and museums
neighborhood_overview: We are in heart of this wonderful and ancient medieval town. Typical restaurants, pizzeria, traditional taverns and old wineries but also international cuisine. Very close to Two Towers, museum, Cinema, San Luca. We love showing people around Bologna. It's easy to have fun in the city just walking through our pictoresque streets, visiting art galleries and historical building. We can stop for a taste of local wine and try some tigella topped with tasty salami. We can get you get the best experience in town. Please ask. We love to help you.
host_about:

host_about:
Sono un viticoltore che si occupa anche di giardini, api, produzione di ortaggi, enologia e arte culinaria! Dopo il Liceo ho trascorso diversi anni in Francia, dove ho frequentato corsi di alta formazione di  cucina, viticoltura, enologia. Ho poi lavorato in Borgogna come tecnico della vigna e consulente presso famose aziende viticole. Sono ritornato in Italia per amore, con il progetto di piantare una vigna tutta mia per poterne un giorno assaporare i frutti! Anche questo rappresenta il podere di Ca' del Genio, per me, mia moglie Marta e le nostre bimbe Irene e Nora.

I‚Äôm Lorenzo, I am a viticulturist but I am also involved in gardening, apiculture, vegetable production, wine and culinary art! After high school I spent several years in France, where I attended advanced training courses in cooking, viticulture, enology. I then worked in Burgundy vineyards as technical consultant for famous wine estates. I came back to Italy for love, with the dream to plant a vineyard my own, for one day enjoy its fruits! This is what also represents the estate of Ca' del Genio for me and for my wife Marta and our daughters Irene and Nora

description: This brand new two-room apt is ideally located in a private garden (shared with us, but you'll have your own space to eat outside!), very close to Bologna's nicest park and to the town center (5 mn by bus, or 10-15 min walk). neighborhood_overview:
The accommodation is located in one of the most exclusive reserved areas of Bologna a few steps from the green of the Margherita gardens and from Porta Castiglione and
we are outside the ZTL zone.
Carrefour Express at 600 meters open 24 hours/ 24 hours.
Porta Castiglione could be called the "Gate of the canals" because next to it entered the city the Savena canal which with its branches provided hydraulic energy and its driving force to dozens and dozens of factories in which both wool and silk worked. It was built in the thirteenth century and renovated several times during the fourteenth, in particular between and 1403. To bring it to its current appearance, there was also a restoration promoted by the Municipality in 1850.
Porta Castiglione was not mentioned in the Descriptio of Cardinal Anglico in 1371, probably because it was temporarily inactive.
host_about:
Hi! We (Luca & Maria) are a married couple who enjoys travelling, swimming, sport, animals and...our city: Bologna!
As we ourselves have used Airbnb and other similar websites in order to find accomodations during our trips, we have a fairly clear picture of what we'd like to have in a rented apartment, and what we expect. We try to give our guests the things that are most dear to us: a warm welcome, comforts,  and...breakfast! We hope you'll find yourselves at home!

name: I 4 GATTI Guesthouse. Room 4, Double 2¬∞ floor
description: 4 Gatti is a guesthouse nestled within an enchanting old villa, boasting six rooms and surrounded by lush gardens. Situated in the picturesque residential neighborhood of via Audinot in Bologna, it offers tranquility and greenery while remaining conveniently close to the city center. By booking one of our private rooms, you gain access to our shared garden and common areas on the first floor, providing opportunities to relax and socialize with fellow guests
neighborhood_overview:
Audinot street is a beautiful boulevard full of old villas with garden in liberty style. Birds are cirping and the city traffic seems far.
We are located in the suburb of porta saragozza, 15 minutes of walk from the center, comfortably reachable from the train station with bus 33.
Along street Saragozza you can find many bars and pastry shops, a bank, a supermarket and many fruits and vegetables shops. From here starts the porch of S.Luca, with more than 650 arcades goes all the way to the top of the hill to the monastery dedicated to the virgin Mary. Throug this arcade (the longest in the world) pass the ‚Äúway of the gods‚Äù, a trekking that goes from Bologna to Florence along the mountains between Emilia Romagna and Tuscany.
host_about: Mi chiamo Filippo e sono nato a Bologna. Amo viaggiare e visto i pochi ostelli presenti a Bologna mi sono deciso ad aprirne uno mio nella vecchia casa di famiglia, sistemandola per ospitare viaggiatori e studenti che vogliono godersi questi bellissima piccola citt√†. Mi piace creare una bella atmosfera in casa e sono sempre disponibile con aiuti e suggerimenti a rendere il vostro soggiorno il pi√π piacevole possibile. Mi piace molto scrivere, il cinema, la musica, i fumetti e spesso sono in giro per i numerosi eventi che Bologna offre su questi argomenti. Amo l'Australia, il mare, pescare, le montagne e lo snowboard.

name: Stanza in Porta San Felice
description: Cosy and bright room in a large apartment (100 sqm) in Porta San Felice, near the station and the airport, as well as in a characteristic area  of the historic centre. The room is very spacious, with a double wooden loft bed and, for those who were not lovers of heights, a very comfortable sofa bed (to be used also to accommodate - in moderation ;-) We are a large family but very respectful and convivial, we have always shared our homes around the world with other people.
host_about: I'm Italian, I'm living in Bologna (Italy). I'm a researcher in Social Sciences specialized in Semiotics, but currently I'm working as Head of Communications Officer in an International Research Center for Environmental Monitoring. Environment and International cooperation are my passions. I'm absolutely crazy for traveling, and when I travel, I like stay at private homes, knowing new people and new towns by their point of view. And I'm not jealous of my private spaces, so I like people to stay in my home. But they have to be as eco-friendly as I am...Environment is very important for me: I would like to let my three children a safe planet.

description:

Wagon-lit e la nostra casa privata dove abbiamo realizzato quattro camere di lusso, ognuna con splendidi letti matrimoniali o singoli, tutte con bagni privati, arredate con il cuore
Si trova nella tranquillit√† di Bologna, un posto favoloso per rilassarsi e distendersi in pace ma nello stesso tempo al centro della citt√†.

Le camere sono tutte climatizzate, armadio e connessione WiFi gratuita, macchina da caff√®, frigo, microonde, bagno privato e TV a schermo piatto, insonorizzate e dotate di vista sul giardino,

Due camere sono fornite di cucina attrezzate dove poter cenare con tranquillit√† o se si vuole mangiare in giardino anche con i propri amici o animali.

Wagon-Lit √® la base ideale per te e il tuo partner, situato nel centro pulsante della citt√†, a sua volta vicini a Firenze, Venezia, Verona, Modena,Parma, Padova.

Wagon-Lit e ideale con gli amici o soli con il proprio patner per rilassarsi e gustare del buon cibo e del buon vino dove "La Grassa Bologna" non si smentisce mail.

name: B&B A due passi dal Lumi√®re / double room
description:
A very comfortable double room, only 5 minutes walking from Via dell'Indipendenza, is available for rent. A nice Italian breakfast is included in the price :)

CHECK IN FROM 12AM UNTIL 10PM, IF ANYONE NEED DIFFERENT TIME HAVE TO CONCORDE BEFORE.
TOURIST TAX HAVE TO BE PAID BEFORE CHECK OUT.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located on Via Lame 57, in the exact center of the artery that connects Piazza Malpighi, the capital of many bus lines, and Porta Lame, one of the 12 access gates to the city inside the old walls.
The neighborhood is one of the historic neighborhoods of Bologna, which is experiencing a new youth thanks to the renovated Mercato delle Erbe, the beautiful Via del Pratello, the Lumiere cinema and many other attractions such as the Museum of Modern Art "MAMBO".

A few minutes walk away is Via Zaragoza with 666 arches (the longest portico in the world), which leads to the Sanctuary of San Luca; the Church of San Francesco with the tombs of the Glossatori; the College of Spain with its beautiful portal; and Via del Pratello, a famous street with lots of bars, taverns and jazzclubs.
The main square of Bologna: Piazza Maggiore,with the church of San Petronio and the newly restored Nettuno statue and all the main monuments are within a 10-minute walk.
host_about:
Sono una ragazza di 36 anni originaria di Lecce, arrivata qui a Bologna quando avevo 19 anni per motivi universitari, alla fine √® diventata la mia seconda citt√†....Sono una persona con mille passioni: amo andare in bici, √® il mio unico mezzo di trasporto in citt√†; sono appassionata di cucina, mi diverto a preparare cene con gli amici ma al contempo provare la grande variet√† di ristoranti/osterie di cui Bologna √® piena. Amo socializzare e conoscere persone,sono una persona fortunata in quanto sono circondata da splendidi amici. Amo la musica in genere, suono il pianoforte. 
Amo viaggiare, appena posso ne approfitto e scappo alla scoperta di nuovi posti.

Amo prendermi cura dei fiori, delle piante e quando la stagione lo permette coltivo un piccolo orto in terrazza.
Non  uso cibi geneticamente modificati.Prediligo prodotti biologici deei dintorni di Bologna, quelli detti anche corta trafila, a km 0.
Ho amici sparsi in tutto il mondo, prima o poi riuscir√≤ ad andar a trovarli tutti.
Penso che non ci sia nulla che ci pu√≤ far crescere pi√π che la condivisione, lo stare insieme ed il prendersi cura di noi e di chi incontriamo sul nostro cammino, che siano umani o animali.
Il sorriso e la gentilezza sono miei alleati.
Il resto lo scoprirete se vorrete esser miei compagni di viaggio.

description:

it consists of a large and bright apartment of over 120 square meters, with 4 bedrooms, of which 1 double Japanese style, large entrance, large pink marble floor of Portugal, such as American bar counter, for breakfast use, large room.
neighborhood_overview:
'Il Castello' is located in the historic center of Bologna, in an exclusive area, within a pedestrian area absolutely quiet and silent, but in the heart of Bologna.
A few meters away are the points of greatest tourist attractions, historical and commercial heart of Bologna: Piazza Maggiore, Piazza del Nettuno, the Basilica di San Petronio, The Cathedral of St. Peter, the Medieval Museum, The Two Towers, Via Indipendenza with its shops, Galleria Cavour, Via D'Azeglio, etc.
host_about:
A causa della pandemia di Covid-19, Il Castello Hostel √® determinato alla tutela della massima salute dei propri ospiti e dei propri collaboratori. 
Per questo motivo, abbiamo implementato un protocollo di sicurezza che comprende: ingresso contingentato di  1 sola persona alla volta per le operazioni di chek-in; utilizzo in alcune aree del sistema di Depurazione Aria tramite la Tecnologia Flash Streamer Daikin per la riduzione dei virus eventualmente presenti;sterilizzazione delle chiavi che le verranno consegnate tramite sistema di luce ultra violetta UVC; controllo della temperatura corporea con termometro medico no-touch a infrarossi prima del check-in e durante la permanenza; indicazione tramite apposita segnaletica della posizione da tenere in reception per il mantenimento della distanza di sicurezza; percorso di sanificazione delle calzature automatico ad ogni ingresso; fornitura di gel disinfettante mani gratuito per gli ospiti; obbligo di utilizzo della mascherina durante tutta la permanenza;operazioni di pulizia e sanificazione quotidiana delle camere e di tutte le aree comuni anche tramite l‚Äôutilizzo di spray germicidi disinfettanti per l‚Äôaria; sanificazione dei bagni pi√π volte al giorno; sanificazione di tutto il sistema di climatizzazione; presenza in tutta la struttura di indicazioni sulle norme da rispettare per il contrasto al coronavirus.
Con il vostro aiuto,collaborazione e comprensione, ci impegniamo a mantenere  Il Castello Covid-free, e a fare in modo che la vostra permanenza sia piacevole come sempre.

Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, Il Castello Hostel is determined to protect the maximum health of its guests and staffs.
For this reason, we have implemented a security protocol that includes: entry of 1 person at a time for chek-in operations; use in some areas of the Air Purification System through Daikin Flash Streamer Technology to reduce any viruses present; sterilized keys  by an ultra violet UVC light system that will be entrust to you; body temperature control with infrared no-touch medical thermometer before check-in and during the stay; special signs of the position to be kept at reception to maintain the safety distance; automatic shoe sanitization path at each entrance; free hand sanitizer gel for guests; must  use the mask during the whole stay; daily cleaning and sanitization of the rooms and all common areas and also through the use of disinfectant germicidal sprays for the air; sanitizing of the bathrooms several times a day; sanitization of the entire air conditioning system; instruction of rules is present in the entire structure to be respected for the fight against coronavirus.

With your help, cooperation and understanding, we commit to keep Covid IL CASTELLO free, and make sure your stay is as pleasant as ever.

host_about:
Wow. Davvero molto difficile scrivere di me. Mi piace incontrare persone in viaggio e condividere l'esperienza dell'incontro.
Da universitario ero iscritto ad Hospitality Club, il sito per viaggiare ed ospitare gratuitamente persone, ma poi ho dovuto smettere. Ora che ho nuovamente la libert√† di ospitare persone in casa, ho pensato che Airbnb fosse fosse il giusto equilibrio tra l'affitto da pagare e il piacere di ospitare i viaggiatori.

Curo l'amministrazione di una compagnia teatrale, gestisco una piccola societ√† che organizza eventi di piazza e servizi bici, mentre con un'altra associazione di cui sono fondatore facciamo la mitica asta di biciclette a basso costo e curo progetti sociali per la citt√† -  E' un lavoro strano, senza orari, che mi porta ad essere spesso fuori casa e sempre a contatto con le persone. Per√≤, escluso il fatto che mi tiene inchiodato a Bologna, mi piace.
Il mondo √® troppo grande per essere visitato tutto, allora ospitare i viaggiatori diventa per me un modo per conosce un pezzo di mondo senza esserci stato.

Cosa mi piace?
mille cose, ne cito qualcuna
cucinare, sia la cucina tradizionale ma anche la sperimentazione;
andare in bici - √® comodo, divertente e rilassante. Poi Bologna in bici √® molto facile;
i giochi - ping pong, biliardino, calcio. Qualsiasi gioco che faccia divertire;
d'inverno mi piace organizzare cene in casa con gli amici, guardare un bel film oppure giocare (carte, risiko, ecc.).

Non mi piace andare alle feste, forse perch√© spesso ne sono l'organizzatore, allora non riesco a rilassarmi e divertirmi fino in fondo.

description: The apartment is in the heart of Bologna, in the historic and lively area of Pratello Street. 10-minute walk  to Piazza Maggiore and Due Torri. neighborhood_overview: Via del Pratello's spirit represents an intact evidence of the city's nightlife tradition, where students and locals converge giving life to a dynamic and vibrant street. Its historical pubs - cheap and no demanding - are the shelter for endless chatting with the company of a beer/glass of wine. Even for a tourist, strolling along this street might be the highest chance to experience the real nightlife scene of Bologna. With the help of few drinks, via del Pratello will embrace you gently, thanks to its welcoming and free spirit.

neighborhood_overview:
Bologna's most multiethnic neighborhood is Bologna's most multiethnic neighborhood, as well as a favorite place for anti-conformist intellectuals, hipsters, and musicians. Once a working-class neighborhood, it is now a hub of people who tend to be open to socializing and cultural exchange. Its iconic place, for me, is a square where people from all backgrounds gather in the afternoon to chat. Another very nice place is the Carosella bar, in Via di Corticella, where the black community of Bologna meets, very kind and welcoming. The neighborhood is very quiet in the evening, you can drink great wine at the Albanian market, or eat in one of the trattorias offering typical Tuscan cuisine, in addition to the various Chinese, Indian and Japanese rotisseries; don't miss the African restaurant Adal on Via Alfieri.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is in the heart of Bolognina, Bologna's historic popular district, just outside the ancient doors of the city center. Very convenient for its proximity to the train station is also very close to the heart of the city: you can reach Piazza Maggiore in 15 minutes walking, or in 4 bus stops.
The Bolognina is experiencing an interesting ferment of new bars, as well as traditional tasty trattorie.
A few steps away is the Testoni Ragazzi theater, which offers beautiful shows for children and teenagers all season long. It is worth going to visit the museum on the massacre of Ustica, with the installation of Boltanski.

name: Cozy room in Casa Dolce Casa
description:
Close to the station, fair and university, the apartment has all the comforts: WiFi, washer-dryer, sheets and towels, air conditioners, balcony and bicycle cellar for bulky objects and bicycle rental service.
The kitchen is spacious and equipped with all appliances.
In the living room there is a large and comfortable sofa, TV and a dining table.
neighborhood_overview:
The proximity to everything is the characteristic of my area, on foot you can go anywhere:
station, 20 min
Fair, 8 min walk
University, 20 min
Piazza Maggiore, 30 min
Arena Parco Nord for concerts, 25 min
hospital, 20 min
Supermarkets, Lidl at 100mt, Coop at 250mt
host_about:
Wow. Davvero molto difficile scrivere di me. Mi piace incontrare persone in viaggio e condividere l'esperienza dell'incontro.
Da universitario ero iscritto ad Hospitality Club, il sito per viaggiare ed ospitare gratuitamente persone, ma poi ho dovuto smettere. Ora che ho nuovamente la libert√† di ospitare persone in casa, ho pensato che Airbnb fosse fosse il giusto equilibrio tra l'affitto da pagare e il piacere di ospitare i viaggiatori.

Curo l'amministrazione di una compagnia teatrale, gestisco una piccola societ√† che organizza eventi di piazza e servizi bici, mentre con un'altra associazione di cui sono fondatore facciamo la mitica asta di biciclette a basso costo e curo progetti sociali per la citt√† -  E' un lavoro strano, senza orari, che mi porta ad essere spesso fuori casa e sempre a contatto con le persone. Per√≤, escluso il fatto che mi tiene inchiodato a Bologna, mi piace.
Il mondo √® troppo grande per essere visitato tutto, allora ospitare i viaggiatori diventa per me un modo per conosce un pezzo di mondo senza esserci stato.

Cosa mi piace?
mille cose, ne cito qualcuna
cucinare, sia la cucina tradizionale ma anche la sperimentazione;
andare in bici - √® comodo, divertente e rilassante. Poi Bologna in bici √® molto facile;
i giochi - ping pong, biliardino, calcio. Qualsiasi gioco che faccia divertire;
d'inverno mi piace organizzare cene in casa con gli amici, guardare un bel film oppure giocare (carte, risiko, ecc.).

Non mi piace andare alle feste, forse perch√© spesso ne sono l'organizzatore, allora non riesco a rilassarmi e divertirmi fino in fondo.

host_about:
Ciao a tutti, sono Pippo! 

Insieme al mio staff di 4 Star Bologna ci occupiamo della gestione di attivit√† extra-alberghiere e strutture ricettive. 
Ad oggi siamo presenti con pi√π di 10 strutture sul territorio bolognese, tutte differenti fra loro poich√® pensate per ogni specifica esigenza dei nostri ospiti. Abbiamo proposte specifiche adatte a:  coppie, lavoratori, famiglie e gruppi di amici.

Se state cercando un luogo dove trascorrere qualche giorno sentendovi come a casa, i nostri appartamenti e le nostre camere sono perfetti per voi!

Da anni ormai il principale obbiettivo di 4 Star √® quello di rendere il soggiorno di ognuno dei nostri ospiti unico e speciale riservando loro tutte le attenzioni che ci si aspetterebbe di trovare in un hotel, ma nella comodit√† e autonomia che offre una casa vacanza. Tutto questo √® possibile grazie al nostro staff, un team altamente qualificato e compatto che sar√† a vostra disposizione dal momento della prenotazione alla vostra partenza, sempre pronto ad esaudire ogni richiesta e ad aiutarvi in caso di qualsiasi necessit√†.

Vi aspettiamo a Bologna, non vediamo l'ora di accogliervi per farvi scoprire la nostra splendida citt√†!

name: Suite con cucina in B&B PaoloFabbri a 50m S.Orsola
description:
Guests will have access to a spacious and bright 40sqm studio with independent entrance, private bathroom with shower and exclusive kitchen use.
It can accommodate up to three people in a double bed + sofa bed and is equipped with air conditioning, TV and WI-FI.
Wooden parquet throughout the apartment that is located in an elegant condominium equipped with an elevator and doormen.
Please do not smoke inside, and pets are not allowed.
Public parking available on the street.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is quiet, central, very convenient to amenities, shops, bars and restaurants.
Sant'Orsola hospital is across the street. Downtown, FS station and Fiera District can be reached by bus in 10 minutes and on foot in 30.

We are in Cyrenaica, a historic district built more than 100 years ago, read the article that Nicola Zanarini of RaiNews dedicated to him:

‚ÄúCyrenaica is a state of mind, not just a physical place in Libya, Bologna or Nev York, as Giorgio Comaschi, an ironic journalist and writer and testimonial of the association, would say.
Founded 110 years ago around what is still called Via Libya, one of the few streets to have kept its original name among the many named after the war and fell for liberation or partisans, who say you want, the popular district just outside the circle of the medieval walls sinks its roots far further back, in 2,900 on Christ, when a Villanovan village stood here. host_about:
Filippo, a 27 year old dreamer with the passion for travels! 
I based my project on the passion for my city. I would like to offer the best service I can putting in this experience all of my knowledge and my people skills! I always see my guests as if it was me travelling, that's why my customer care is at the highest standard!! Hope to meet you all in mine, or in your place around the World!
P.S.: Please remember Airbnb hosts are not hotels and we have a regular life to combine with this hobby! In case you are arriving late respect to the time we agreed with, your flight has been deleted or postponed, PLEASE inform us immediately and don't make us wait pointlessly for you. Please note that for late check in, late check out, and late arrival time, a 30 Euros fee may be applied. 
Thank you for understanding :)

neighborhood_overview:
Europe‚Äôs oldest university town, intellectual, cultural and creative.

PIAZZA SANTO STEFANO (50m) one of the best square in Europe. Visit the Seven Churches and take a break in a bar bars under the arches: a lovely spot for a sundowner.

VIA UGO BASSI, VIA RIZZOLI and VIA INDIPENDENZA (300m) At weekends they are pedestrianised and fill with shoppers and street performers.

VIA ZAMBONI and PIAZZA VERDI (300m) is the heart of students life, here you can find a great nightlife with cheap pubs and bars

Bologna has several nicknames ‚Äì la dotta (the learned) and la rossa (the red, for its leftwing politics) - but it is la grassa (the fat) that‚Äôs perhaps the most fitting. Food is a very big deal here, as it is throughout the Emilia-Romagna region, the home of ham, balsamic vinegar and parmesan. Try Tortellini, Tagliatelle al Rag√π and Mortadella.


Many of Italian cuisine‚Äôs heavy hitters ‚Äì tagliatelle al rag√π, mortadella, tortellini,

host_about:
Ciao a tutti, sono Pippo! 

Insieme al mio staff di 4 Star Bologna ci occupiamo della gestione di attivit√† extra-alberghiere e strutture ricettive.
 
Ad oggi siamo presenti con pi√π di 10 strutture sul territorio bolognese, tutte differenti fra loro poich√® pensate per ogni specifica esigenza dei nostri ospiti. Abbiamo proposte specifiche adatte a:  coppie, lavoratori, famiglie e gruppi di amici.

Se state cercando un luogo dove trascorrere qualche giorno sentendovi come a casa, i nostri appartamenti e le nostre camere sono perfetti per voi!

Da anni ormai il principale obbiettivo di 4 Star √® quello di rendere il soggiorno di ognuno dei nostri ospiti unico e speciale riservando loro tutte le attenzioni che ci si aspetterebbe di trovare in un hotel, ma nella comodit√† e autonomia che offre una casa vacanza.

Tutto questo √® possibile grazie al nostro staff, un team altamente qualificato e compatto che sar√† a vostra disposizione dal momento della prenotazione alla vostra partenza, sempre pronto ad esaudire ogni richiesta e ad aiutarvi in caso di qualsiasi necessit√†.

Vi aspettiamo a Bologna, non vediamo l'ora di accogliervi per farvi scoprire la nostra splendida citt√†!

Just a 5-minute walk from the central train station, 200 meters from Via Indipendenza, the main street for strolling and shopping, a 10-minute walk from the Two Towers, and close to the Fair district.

host_about:
Ciao a tutti, sono Pippo! 

Insieme al mio staff di 4 Star Bologna ci occupiamo della gestione di attivit√† extra-alberghiere e strutture ricettive.
 
Ad oggi siamo presenti con pi√π di 10 strutture sul territorio bolognese, tutte differenti fra loro poich√® pensate per ogni specifica esigenza dei nostri ospiti. Abbiamo proposte specifiche adatte a:  coppie, lavoratori, famiglie e gruppi di amici.

Se state cercando un luogo dove trascorrere qualche giorno sentendovi come a casa, i nostri appartamenti e le nostre camere sono perfetti per voi!

Da anni ormai il principale obbiettivo di 4 Star √® quello di rendere il soggiorno di ognuno dei nostri ospiti unico e speciale riservando loro tutte le attenzioni che ci si aspetterebbe di trovare in un hotel, ma nella comodit√† e autonomia che offre una casa vacanza.

Tutto questo √® possibile grazie al nostro staff, un team altamente qualificato e compatto che sar√† a vostra disposizione dal momento della prenotazione alla vostra partenza, sempre pronto ad esaudire ogni richiesta e ad aiutarvi in caso di qualsiasi necessit√†.

Vi aspettiamo a Bologna, non vediamo l'ora di accogliervi per farvi scoprire la nostra splendida citt√†!

Buona permanenza a tutti.

I hope you will enjoy your stay.

host_about:
Hi, my name is Luca, and I am excited to introduce myself to you. I have been working in the banking industry for over a decade and have a background in computer science engineering, which has allowed me to develop a unique set of skills that have been invaluable in my professional life.

Aside from my career, I am a passionate traveler and food enthusiast. I believe that food is a window into understanding different cultures and I enjoy trying new dishes from all over the world. I am also an amateur cook and enjoy experimenting with new recipes and ingredients in the kitchen. My passion for food has led me to develop an interest in the hospitality industry, which I believe is all about making people feel at home.

I am also a passionate ecologist and take great consideration to be eco-friendly and take care of the planet. I come from a family with a strong tradition in the hospitality industry and love to provide excellent service and make guests feel at home. I am excited to bring my skills, knowledge, and passion to this field and can't wait to meet all of you and make your stay as enjoyable as possible.

name: B&B Galleria Cavour camera DELUXE
description:
We started in July 2018 , with a total demolition of all the walls to create three beautiful soundproof rooms with bathrooms.
A modern and at the same time very functional style was chosen. The choice of furnishings has been taken care of by our architects and specifically: Antonio Lupi toilets, Gessi faucets, Garofoli fixtures.
For the comfort of our guests, the beds are extra large in size with memory foam mattresses and pillows.
neighborhood_overview:
Galleria Cavour has always been a point of reference for the exclusive shopping of Bolognese but not only.

Since 1959, the presence of important international brands has allowed the Gallery to carve out a place of honour in the world of fashion luxury both nationally, as well as in cities such as Milan and Rome, and internationally.
In fact, if in the capitals of the world elegant shopping takes place in High Streets, Galleria Cavour is the classic exception to the rule, as it is the only one indoors.

Strategically located in the heart of Bologna, the Gallery is housed in historic palaces that represent authentic jewels of Italian art capable of hiding, within them, a small world to be discovered: it is precisely among historical frescoes, damask and nineteenth-century marble floors that the most prestigious boutiques on the world luxury scene fit.

name: Cinema Lovers' Flat / L'appartamento dei cinefili
description: Welcome to our home! We are a young couple who loves cinema, art, travel and good food. Our home is a perfect place to relax and work from. The flat is spacious and bright and the neighbourhood is safe. We're very close to the historic centre of Bologna and also some green spaces. name: Casa S.Luca
description:
Private room, double bed. If there are 3 or 4 guests, the mezzanine bed will also be prepared. If the guests are 1o2,it will only be possible to use the double bed. With 7e per day, bike rental.
Ground floor. Quiet road,convenient to shops and bus20,14,21ecc.
Shared small bathroom. Kitchen is not available.
You can eat in the room,being careful not to get dirty,and cleaning. 5/10 minutes on foot there are pizza,trattorias,sushi also delivery. Supermarket. NO SMOKING.
neighborhood_overview: In the area of S.Luca (and behind the Dall 'Ara stadium), at the foot of the hill of S.Luca, and then in front of the most famous and longest portico of Bologna, which going up the hill leads to the famous basilica of S. Luca (portico candidate to Unesco heritage, historical destination of pilgrimages). Apartment in internal street therefore  extremely quiet, despite being located in front of the hill and porch destination of pedestrian tourism. 5 minutes walk from the wonderful park of Villa delle Rose , 8 minutes walk from the equally wonderful park of Villa Spada, with Textile Museum, historical monuments etc. Other parks 10/15 minutes walk. Bicycle path at 5 minutesTractoria Bolognese at 2 minutes walk, takeaway pizzerias or restaurant pizzerias at 4 /8 minutes walk, Coop with self-service hot table and small shopping center at 10 minutes walk. Shops and clubs of all kinds within 5/30 minutes walk.

name: | Camera Rossa, doppia, B&B AlbertaD |
description:
Welcome to the Red Room of the AlbertaD B&B, let yourself be enveloped in the warm comfort of velvets and satin curtains, while relaxing in the view of the private inner courtyard.
The furnishings of the room recall what this house was, a handbag factory, and with them the skill with which rare and precious fabrics were cut sewn and made by expert artisans who lived and worked here.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood includes via del pratello, a historic gathering of nightlife, full of snacks, snacks and bars where you can refresh and relax after long walks around the city!

name: Double room | private entrance | en-suite bathroom
description: double bedroom with private entrance and large en-suite bathroom. It is located on the third floor of a building with lift in a very central and strategic area, just a 10-minute walk from Piazza Maggiore and 13 from the central railway station. All major tourist attractions are at a walking distance. Recently renovated, the room is equipped with air conditioning, wi-fi, internet TV, refrigerator and digital keys for 24/7 access. Perfect for singles, professionals and couples.
neighborhood_overview: Located within the ancient city walls of Bologna, only a few minutes walk from the railway station and from the main sights of the old town, the apartment offers a practical and comfortable accommodation both for visiting the city and for participating to the events of the Bologna Fiere exhibition center.It is located just a few steps from the MAMBO (Museum of Modern Art of Bologna) and the film library, and only 12 minutes walk from the two towers and Piazza Maggiore. In the neighborhood there are two parks, which often host demonstrations and events.
host_about:
Hi, my name is Luca, and I am excited to introduce myself to you. I have been working in the banking industry for over a decade and have a background in computer science engineering, which has allowed me to develop a unique set of skills that have been invaluable in my professional life.

Aside from my career, I am a passionate traveler and food enthusiast. I believe that food is a window into understanding different cultures and I enjoy trying new dishes from all over the world. I am also an amateur cook and enjoy experimenting with new recipes and ingredients in the kitchen. My passion for food has led me to develop an interest in the hospitality industry, which I believe is all about making people feel at home.

I am also a passionate ecologist and take great consideration to be eco-friendly and take care of the planet. I come from a family with a strong tradition in the hospitality industry and love to provide excellent service and make guests feel at home. I am excited to bring my skills, knowledge, and passion to this field and can't wait to meet all of you and make your stay as enjoyable as possible.

name: Single room with private bathroom, historic center
description:
The apartment is at the 4th floor - with 2 elevators- of a building in the historic city center of Bologna. I live here, it's my house, and I rent the spare room I have for guests.
The house is on two floors: entrance, kitchen, living room and balcony on the 1st floor; 2 bedrooms and 2 private bathrooms on the 2nd.
Many plants, books, a piano and much light!
Everything reachable by foot: main monuments and attractions, restaurants and cafes, train station.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is one of the most lively of the city, between the most famous part of the city center, the one of Piazza Maggiore, via Indipendenza and via Rizzoli, and the University area. Monuments, museums and a lot of restaurants and bars are just at walking distance from the apartment.
host_about: I'm an Italian photographer, photography teacher and curator.

Just a 5-minute walk from the central train station, 200 meters from Via Indipendenza, the main street for strolling and shopping, a 10-minute walk from the Two Towers, and close to the Fair district.

Staying outside the restricted traffic zone (ZTL) of the historic center, it is also ideal for those traveling by car.

name: Residenza storica via Castiglione-Rizzoli
description: The residence is located on the (first) floor of a building with a great historical and architectural value located next to the Castiglione Tower and the Duse Theatre. The interior is finely renovated in 2020 and furnished with antique furniture that has always belonged to the property of the building. It is accessed through a monumental courtyard with vintage sculptures and paintings, for a unique and fascinating experience, totally immersive in the Middle Ages that connotes the city.
neighborhood_overview:
Located between Via Castiglioni and Via Santo Stefano, perhaps the best neighborhood in the old town of Bologna in terms of importance of residential buildings, security and tranquility.
Located halfway between the main monuments of the historic center (500-700 meters) and the avenues (400-600 meters). Close to the Sant'Orsola Malpighi Hospital, just over a kilometre away. This makes the apartment convenient and easily accessible for both tourists and those who are in Bologna for business or hospital visits.

name: Exotic style private room in modern design house
description:
üé©Hello! I'm Antonio and I'm happy to show you my house, a few steps from Bologna station, the fair and the centre

üå¥The room, in an exotic style, is furnished with some of the memorabilia that I bring with me from my travels around the world

üçπThe room has a private bathroom, independent entrance and overlooks a private balcony, perfect for reading or a drink in good weather

‚ö°Ô∏èBolognina is the "next big thing" in Bologna. I'm at your disposal for tips on the neighborhood and city!
neighborhood_overview:
üáÆüáπ
Bolognina is moving from being the historic neighborhood to the "next big thing" in Bologna. Located close to the historic center and next to the train station, the one where I live is a multi-racial neighborhood that offers many attractions: restaurants (Bolognese, ethnic, gourmet), vintage pubs, independent bookstores, artisanal bars, outdoor theaters and underground clubs. Posts, banks, supermarkets, and the main amenities can be reached in a few minutes.

Price tip: Bologna has changed a lot in recent years. Those who do not visit a lot will be surprised: the center, and more, has become half of international tourists and offers services that until recently did not exist. This change is reflected (in negative) in prices: those in the center are very high, those in the neighborhoods nearby, including Bolognina, a little more affordable.

Local types: so many, it depends on what you want to do. In Bolognina I recommend Forno Brisa for breakfast, Trattoria

name: Cozy Studio for couples - 4starbologna
description:
Comfortable mini-apartment of about 30sqm located on Viale Angelo Masini, one of the city's main avenues surrounding the city walls of Bologna's historic center.

Just 500m from the central train station and a short walk from the historic centre and the Bologna Fair, it is perfect for a business or leisure stay. In a strategic area for those arriving by car since it is on the outer border of the limited traffic zone (ZTL) of the centre
neighborhood_overview:
The studio apartment is located on Viale Angelo Masini, inside a quiet apartment building in the residential area on the city walls of Bologna's historic center.

name: Alto Gallery Home ti accoglie a Bologna Cirenaica
description: Alfredo's paintings, in art at_to, gave birth to Alto Gallery Home: 3 double bedrooms with a bathroom, without a kitchen. Bright rooms, a few steps from the center, the S. Orsola Hospital and comfortable for the Fair. The particular decor of the showers inspired the names: Ficus, Garden, and Palm Tree. We rent rooms individually, max 2 people per room (beds not divisible). In the Palm there is a third bed. In Ficus and Garden there is the terrace. Convenient parking.
neighborhood_overview:
Walking through the streets of the Cyrenaica neighborhood, you can breathe the most genuine Bolognese air: the osteria "Da Vito" is one of the oldest, famous for having hosted illustrious biassanots ‚Äì those who stayed all night for taverns ‚Äì such as Lucio Dalla, Francesco Guccini (who lived a stone's throw from here, in Via Paolo Fabbri). You can also find a fruit and vegetable market in the immediate vicinity, as well as regional specialties, restaurants, pizzerias and bars also for celiacs and vegetarians, and a supermarket.
Continuing from Via Massarenti towards Via San Vitale, full of shops and restaurants, you can reach the center, under the 2 Towers, the symbol par excellence of Bologna.
host_about: Mi chiamo Paola e insieme a mio marito Alfredo abbiamo aperto questa attivit√† nel 2021. Mi occupo di servizi di traduzione e organizzazione congressi, mentre Alfredo √® un ingegnere con la passione della pittura. Ci piace incontrare nuove persone e, quando non possiamo viaggiare, il mondo viene da noi! Questo ci entusiasma: possiamo raccontare ai nostri ospiti cosa offre Bologna e scoprire le bellezze della loro citt√†.

name: B&B da Arturo. Camera con Bagno privato, Bologna
description:
In a new and modern context.
Near the center, the station and the airport shuttle, convenient to the fairgrounds. The apartment on the 3rdfloor with elevator (last).

We are in front of the Nervi shed where the brand new square dedicated to Lucio Dalla is located.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the Naval District, in an area of new construction and under development.
In a few minutes walk you can reach the Villa Angeletti park where you can practice outdoor sports or take a pleasant walk in nature, you will also find a kiosk to have a drink and listen to live music (in summer) .
If you want to visit the Museum of Ustica you can also reach it on foot.
In the summer you can spend your evenings at the after railway work, where you can watch the outdoor cinema screenings of the Puccini Arena, or drink food and listen to live music in one of the various venues. If you need more information and contacts, I'll be happy to help.

Located in the Stadium area, this apartment offers the convenience of downtown, the train station and the airport ten minutes away, with tranquility of a quiet, green and safe area.

The apartment is total white to further enhance the tranquility and beauty of the place.

neighborhood_overview: The dawn of the nineteenth century sees the city of Bologna, like the rest of Europe, struggling with the great social, political and economic transformations that the overwhelming Napoleonic enterprise brings with it, destined to profoundly renew the cultural climate by sweeping away the ancient institutional structures and inserting the city within a modern and centralized State. Even the Pontifical Restoration, with its heavy burden of limitations, fails to bear the vivid hopes of renewal that the reforming ideas of France have aroused in the souls of the Bolognese, eager to get out of the economic and political immobility to which governmental restrictions, obsolete in a country in the process of modernization, force them. Movements such as the Carboneria and other minor political organizations, aspiring to the unification and independence of Italy or at least oriented towards a policy of progressive secularization, gather the underground discontent at the base of the 1831 motions;

description: The charming studio is located on the (first) floor of a building with great historical and architectural value located next to the famous Palazzo Bentivolgio. neighborhood_overview: Bologna is home to the oldest university in Europe and the city owes much of its youthful vitality and thriving cultural life to the formidable student population, concentrated in the lively university district. Visit this area to discover its reserve of cafes and clubs, along with fascinating historical museums and buildings. With a large historic centre that has been built over the millennia, Bologna is rich in important architectural and cultural monuments.

description: Cozy Private single bedroom in my gracious apt. neighborhood_overview:
The quiet and residential area of Costa Zaragoza is known for its Baroque-style Sanctuary of Our Lady of San Luca, located on a hill with panoramic views and reachable through a long covered arcade. The Renato Dall 'Ara Stadium, with the famous Marathon Tower, dates back to the 1920s and hosts the home matches of the local football team Bologna FC. In Via Zaragoza and Via Andrea Costa there are small convenience stores, as well as cozy cafes and restaurants that serve classic regional cuisine.
The Costa / Zaragoza neighborhood is located near the center of Bologna and occupies the entire territory that goes from the historic center to the border with the nearby municipality of Casalecchio di Reno.
Its large territorial extension means that there are morphologically different areas within it. In addition to the presence of important rivers such as the Rhine, we must emphasize the high density of the neighborhood that joins the green and tranquility environment represented by

neighborhood_overview: The location is convenient both to public transport to the center and station, and to the bypass (exit 11). The S.Orsola Polyclinic, as well as the University of Bologna, and the famous Cirenaica neighborhood, can be reached on foot, or in a few bus stops. The city center is only two kilometers away. In the immediate vicinity there are several supermarkets, the pharmacy, a newsstand,  bar and trattorias/pizzerias, vast public gardens, a municipal library, the parish church, a cinema. The owner, who loves biking, will be able to provide a lot of information for bike rides and quiet streets, and in general about places to visit throughout the metropolitan city, which is native, and in the region.
host_about: Sono di formazione pedagogista e antropologa. Ho passato circa 7 anni tra Africa, Palestina, Haiti, lavorando come cooperante per gli aiuti umanitari, soprattutto in zone di guerra. Ho un mio sito web. Da anni lavoro come docente nella scuola primaria statale. Ho scritto vari libri pedagogici. Mi fa piacere accogliere il mondo in casa mia. Amo la musica, la fotografia, la biciletta, la natura, il trekking. Sar√≤ felice di darti informazioni.

host_about:
Ciao a tutti, sono Pippo!

Ad oggi siamo presenti con pi√π di 10 strutture sul territorio bolognese, tutte differenti fra loro poich√® pensate per ogni specifica esigenza dei nostri ospiti. Abbiamo proposte specifiche adatte a:  coppie, lavoratori, famiglie e gruppi di amici.

Se state cercando un luogo dove trascorrere qualche giorno sentendovi come a casa, i nostri appartamenti e le nostre camere sono perfetti per voi!

Da anni ormai il principale obbiettivo di 4 Star √® quello di rendere il soggiorno di ognuno dei nostri ospiti unico e speciale riservando loro tutte le attenzioni che ci si aspetterebbe di trovare in un hotel, ma nella comodit√† e autonomia che offre una casa vacanza.

Tutto questo √® possibile grazie al nostro staff, un team altamente qualificato e compatto che sar√† a vostra disposizione dal momento della prenotazione alla vostra partenza, sempre pronto ad esaudire ogni richiesta e ad aiutarvi in caso di qualsiasi necessit√†.

Vi aspettiamo a Bologna, non vediamo l'ora di accogliervi per farvi scoprire la nostra splendida citt√†!

La Cooperativa Sociale DoMani realizza progetti di accoglienza e integrazione sociale per richiedenti asilo e attivit√† di inserimento lavorativo per fasce deboli. 
DoMani, specializzata nel settore dell‚Äôimmigrazione, accoglie incondizionatamente persone fragili e genera impatto sociale nel territorio di appartenenza. Di fatto, in stretta collaborazione con l‚ÄôOrdine dei Servi di Maria, 
gestisce gli spazi dell‚ÄôEremo di Ronzano, dedicandoli a: 
- Quattro comunit√† di accoglienza per rifugiati politici (Comunit√† per minori, neo maggiorenni, famiglie e adulti fragili)
- Affittacamere sociale co-gestito con i rifugiati politici residenti 
- Attivit√† di agricoltura sociale finalizzata all‚Äôinserimento di fasce deboli
- Laboratori ed eventi sociali destinati a scuole e comunit√† locale

Debre Mariam is a  Social Guest House located within the famous Church of Ronzano. The peculiarity of Debre Mariam is that it belongs to the Social Cooperative DoMani, which focuses on social inclusion and job integration projects for marginalised people. 
The Social Guest House is co-managed by and gives home to political refugees, which are guaranteed job stability and financial independence via any income resulting from the business.

host_about:
La Cooperativa Sociale DoMani realizza progetti di accoglienza e integrazione sociale per richiedenti asilo e attivit√† di inserimento lavorativo per fasce deboli. 
DoMani, specializzata nel settore dell‚Äôimmigrazione, accoglie incondizionatamente persone fragili e genera impatto sociale nel territorio di appartenenza. Di fatto, in stretta collaborazione con l‚ÄôOrdine dei Servi di Maria, 
gestisce gli spazi dell‚ÄôEremo di Ronzano, dedicandoli a: 
- Quattro comunit√† di accoglienza per rifugiati politici (Comunit√† per minori, neo maggiorenni, famiglie e adulti fragili)
- Affittacamere sociale co-gestito con i rifugiati politici residenti 
- Attivit√† di agricoltura sociale finalizzata all‚Äôinserimento di fasce deboli
- Laboratori ed eventi sociali destinati a scuole e comunit√† locale

______________
Debre Mariam is a  Social Guest House located within the famous Church of Ronzano. The peculiarity of Debre Mariam is that it belongs to the Social Cooperative DoMani, which focuses on social inclusion and job integration projects for marginalised people. 
The Social Guest House is co-managed by and gives home to political refugees, which are guaranteed job stability and financial independence via any income resulting from the business.

name: Suite Iride - Residenza Palazzo Marchesini
description:
In the heart of Bologna, a few steps from the towers, between the Oratorio di S. Cecilia and the church of San Martino, there is a place where time stands still.

Take a moment to savor old Bologna, in a rare silence in the historic center.

Only us can find the beauty of the period furnishings, the comfort of being in the heart of downtown and a breathtaking view just like the one we offer you.

In the price you will find: rich breakfast, linen, cleaning, tourist and culinary recommendations.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood where Residenza Palazzo Marchesini is located is the heart of historic Bologna.
Rich with churches, towers, alleyways, it is a stone's throw from the famous towers of Bologna (Asinelli and Garisenda), in an area where you can find places to eat and drink at all hours.
It is a neighborhood that is the beating heart of the city, where life is present until late at night, without this making it difficult to sleep in our quiet rooms. Culture and fun are guaranteed.
host_about:
Ho 63 anni e vivo con mio figlio in un grande appartamento posto nel cuore della Bologna medievale. Avendo molto spazio a disposizione ho pensato di accogliere persone che desiderino visitare Bologna, una citt√† che scoprirete essere meravigliosa! Dalle mie terrazze potrete vedere Bologna dall'alto a 360 gradi.

name: Suite Egle - Residenza Palazzo Marchesini
description:
In the heart of Bologna, a few steps from the towers, between the Oratorio di S. Cecilia and the church of San Martino, there is a place where time stands still.

Take a moment to savor old Bologna, in a rare silence in the historic center.

Only us can find the beauty of the period furnishings, the comfort of being in the heart of downtown and a breathtaking view just like the one we offer you.

In the price you will find: rich breakfast, linen, cleaning, tourist and culinary recommendations.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood where Residenza Palazzo Marchesini is located is the heart of historic Bologna.
Rich with churches, towers, alleyways, it is a stone's throw from the famous towers of Bologna (Asinelli and Garisenda), in an area where you can find places to eat and drink at all hours.
It is a neighborhood that is the beating heart of the city, where life is present until late at night, without this making it difficult to sleep in our quiet rooms. Culture and fun are guaranteed.
host_about:
Ho 63 anni e vivo con mio figlio in un grande appartamento posto nel cuore della Bologna medievale. Avendo molto spazio a disposizione ho pensato di accogliere persone che desiderino visitare Bologna, una citt√† che scoprirete essere meravigliosa! Dalle mie terrazze potrete vedere Bologna dall'alto a 360 gradi.
Adoro essere un host: ricevo ospiti da tutto il mondo, e mi piace parlare con loro: un arricchimento personale continuo e senza eguali.

name: S.Orsola Sleep&Go
description: The apartment is located in the historic Cirenaica district 200m from the S.Orsola Polyclinic, surrounded by the famous out-of-town taverns, 5 minutes walk from the historic center and university area. The two towers are a 10-minute walk away, while Piazza Maggiore and the quadrilateral are 15 minutes away. The area is served by buses 25, 36, 37 with which you can reach the central station in 15 minutes, or line 60 that takes you to the fair in 20 minutes. The Rimesse TPer station is 400m away.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood born in the years of the Italian-Turban war, the Cirenaica of Bologna initially had its streets dedicated to the cities related to the conquest of Libya. Only after World War II, the Mayor Dozza decided to rename them in honor of the Heroes of Resistance. To this day, only the Via Libya, the main artery that runs through the neighborhood, remains attached to the original name. The urban architecture present is unmatched in Bologna, thanks to the large condominiums built by the "Coop Risanamento" (each with a commemorative plaque), which alternate with the delightful houses of typical Emilian style with exposed brick, bright colors and often having two twin entrance doors, located next to the other, with 3 steps to enter. The neighborhood's streets are regular, making up a chess house that hugs some of Bologna's most famous tavernas (Trattoria da Vito above all), a neighborhood market, several historic bars, a shared garden, a cottage to exchange books on your own, lots
host_about: Ospitare in casa propria qualcuno, √® un modo per intrecciare le proprie vite per un breve periodo. description:
Our double room with private bathroom offers maximum comfort in a central and quiet location.

Close to bars, restaurants, pizzerias and shops, and we are a few steps from the Cedri park and the Bellaria hospital.

neighborhood_overview:
The district is located immediately after Bologna on the Savena stream which separates Bologna from San Lazzaro.

It is located in a very central position served by all buses to Bologna, surrounded by many shops, Conad supermarket, bars, pizzerias, restaurants, Mc Donald's, a few steps from the Bellaria hospital.

Between two large parks: the Parco dei Cedri and the Parco della Resistenza with sports and recreational facilities with the large ARCI canteen.

A few minutes from the center of Bologna, from the motorways and the ring road, you can easily reach the Bologna fair and the FICO Eataly World food park.

name: Stanza della Rosa - Bibli√≤Rooms Guesthouse
description: The Stanza della Rosa is one of the 6 rooms with private bathroom that make up the Bibli√≤ Rooms guesthouse. This bright and elegant room has a colorful ceiling and a bouquet of roses covering the bed wall. The bathroom is large, with an antique mirror and a comfortable shower cubicle. The room has a hotel-level double bed, desk, wardrobe, SmartTV and tables with kettle, cups, selection of teas and herbal teas, biscuits. The special touch is the flowered terrace overlooking the rooftops.
neighborhood_overview:
The Bibli√≤ Rooms guesthouse is located in the historic center and its rooms overlook the ancient and silent Via San Giorgio. The entrance is in via Nazario Sauro, a side street of via Ugo Bassi which is one of the main arteries of the center of Bologna. In 5-10 minutes on foot you can reach the major artistic and cultural attractions such as Piazza Maggiore, the Basilica of San Petronio, the 2 Towers, the Seven Churches, the Pavaglione and its boutiques.
Alongside via Nazario Sauro is the Mercato delle Erbe, a typical covered market which also houses lounge bars and restaurants and is one of the liveliest meeting points in the city.
The surrounding streets have trattorias and typical restaurants where you can taste the best traditional cuisine.

host_about:
Mi piace viaggiare, quando fisicamente non lo posso fare, viaggio con la fantasia e leggo. Amo il cinema e la buona musica.
Mi diverto a dipingere, a cucinare, sperimento piatti di cucina internazionale, ed anche della buona cucina bolognese.
Amo prendermi cura dei fiori, delle piante e quando la stagione lo permette coltivo un piccolo orto in terrazza.
Non  uso cibi geneticamente modificati.Prediligo prodotti biologici deei dintorni di Bologna, quelli detti anche corta trafila, a km 0.
Ho amici sparsi in tutto il mondo, prima o poi riuscir√≤ ad andar a trovarli tutti.
Penso che non ci sia nulla che ci pu√≤ far crescere pi√π che la condivisione, lo stare insieme ed il prendersi cura di noi e di chi incontriamo sul nostro cammino, che siano umani o animali.
Il sorriso e la gentilezza sono miei alleati.
Il resto lo scoprirete se vorrete esser miei compagni di viaggio.

name: Romantic Boho room, monthly rental
description: We are a fun, funky, cosy cheerful rooftop apartment 20 minutes from Piazza Maggiore. We offer a cosy shabby-chic guest room and shared bath in our private home in 9th floor penthouse. Our garden terrace has beautiful view of the city and surrounding hills. Upscale quiet neighborhood with good restaurants, grocery stores, national park. Each of our 3 rooms are creatively designed with thoughtful details, a comfortable double bed + mattress pad, mini fridge & kitchen access, and a nice view.
neighborhood_overview: We are in upscale residential neighborhood of Bologna, within ten minutes of river path, large new supermarket, many restaurants, cafes and shops in walking distance.  There is a fabulous *slow food* Italian restaurant across the street, a pub two minutes away serving a wide range of beers, garden bar around the corner that is open late. The famous national park is a five minute drive from the house, with miles of trails, hidden ruins, caves, and scenic overlooks. For accessing the historical Bologna city center, we are 15-20 minute bus ride.
host_about:
We are an Italian-American couple that enjoy hosting travelers in our home, sharing some Lambrusco on our garden terraces and getting to meet people from all over the world. We usually spend 3 months of the year abroad, whether in Indonesia, Turkey, Greece, or Northern California, we enjoy outdoor adventures, photography and music. 

Nicole is a swimmer-runner-cyclist, who worked as a costume designer in Los Angeles before moving to Italy. She loves textiles, gardening, cooking and currently works as a freelancer writer and graphic designer while raising our two small daughters.

Manu grew up in nearby Modena, has a passion for Italian food, and spent the last ten years touring Italy/Europe as a pro musician before settling in Bologna to work in advertising. He loves sports, especially surfing when we can stay by the ocean.

We really enjoy living in Bologna, scootering through the appenine backcountry, exploring the medieval fortresses, and beautiful Bolognese streets at night. For us it will always be the romantic Italian city where we met and married, and we love to help visitors discover the hidden secrets of this often overlooked gem of a city, and surrounding areas.

We have three guest rooms at the front of the house are set up to be cosy retreats with a nice view while traveling in Italy. It is possible to come and go independently, or if you‚Äôre feeling social our common kitchen is a happy place to share a glass of wine or cappuccino, some chats and a taste of Italy for any travelers who would appreciate a local welcome with a flavor of home.

The single rooms are elegant accommodations with a French bed (110x195cm) all different from each other, some with original wooden beams from the 12th century. neighborhood_overview: Art Hotel Commercianti enjoys an exclusive location adjacent to the Basilica of San Petronio, in Piazza Maggiore, which makes it ideal for your stay in the city. host_about:
Se stai cercando una sistemazione nel centro di Bologna, L‚ÄôArt Hotel Commercianti √® la soluzione ideale: un boutique hotel situato nel cuore del centro medievale, nell‚Äôedificio storico che ospit√≤ il Comune di Bologna del XII secolo. Il garage √® comodamente accessibile e riservato alle auto degli Ospiti. Il nostro Hotel di charme, adiacente a Piazza Maggiore, offre un‚Äôattenzione personalizzata ed un servizio di ospitalit√† di altissima qualit√† che gli hanno permesso di ricevere dal Touring Club Italiano il prestigioso attestato ‚ÄúStanze Italiane‚Äù.

neighborhood_overview: Bologna is a city of art, culture and trade. The capital of Emilia-Romagna is also known as ‚ÄúDotta‚Äù (erudite), being the oldest university of the West, as ‚ÄúGrassa‚Äù (fat) for its gastronomic delights and ‚ÄúRossa‚Äù (red) for the colours characterising its old town. Its soul is in the medieval old town, one of the biggest in Europe, dotted in taverns, workshops and theatres, characterised by almost 40 kms of porticoes. In the city centre there is Piazza Maggiore, where the charm of medieval buildings is perfectly combined with modernity. Not to be missed are the Fountain of Neptune by Giambologna and the Medieval Towers, ‚ÄúTorre degli Asinelli‚Äù and ‚ÄúTorre della Garisenda‚Äù, part of a rich cultural heritage preserved in several museums, art galleries and religious buildings. It is allowed to leave Bologna only after having tried its gastronomic products, among which mortadella, tortellini, rag√π alla bolognese while sipping famous Doc wines from the Bologna hills! Rich in exhibitions, fairs and

Wonderful Italy is the largest Italian company of hospitality and experiences, in terms of number of directly-managed holiday homes and marketed tourist experiences.

name: Casa Zanardi
description: Casa Zanardi  is more than a home! It's a place to live where you'll find a lot of harmony, diversity, and the joy of being together.
neighborhood_overview:
Nearby there are several parks with children's games, where you can relax on sunny days. In 10 minutes you can walk to the Science Museum. Below the house is one of the best pizzerias in Bologna, a pharmacy (if needed), a tobacco shop, a supermarket and various restaurants. The old town is only a 15-minute drive/bus ride away, and the bus stop is right below the house. You can also get there in 20 minutes by bike maximum.

Bologna is located in the center of Italy and is well connected to other renowned tourist destinations. By train
Florence, in 30 minutes;
Milan, in 1 hour;
Venice, in 1 hour and a half;
Rome, in 2 hours.
The sea is also about an hour away by car.

The city is known for its very active social life and for being on a human scale with its many green areas, bike paths, good food, cultural offerings and relaxed air that you can breathe.
host_about: I love to travel, meet new people and discover the world also through the people I meet and host in the house. I also love cooking and its diversity, good music and green spaces. I'm more than happy to welcome you in our nest :-)
