name: Penthouse suite with private garden terrace
description: Romantic suite with private dining room, living room with stone fireplace, sofa couch, and private rooftop terrace with seating area for alfresco dining. The small bedroom has ceiling murals and panoramic views of both the hills and historic skyline. Adjoining the suite is a communal kitchen space, and large (shared) bathroom. Storage space is limited, but views are abounding.
host_about:
We are an Italian-American couple that enjoy hosting travelers in our home, sharing some Lambrusco on our garden terraces and getting to meet people from all over the world. We usually spend 3 months of the year abroad, whether in Indonesia, Turkey, Greece, or Northern California, we enjoy outdoor adventures, photography and music. 

Nicole is a swimmer-runner-cyclist, who worked as a costume designer in Los Angeles before moving to Italy. She loves textiles, gardening, cooking and currently works as a freelancer writer and graphic designer while raising our two small daughters.

Manu grew up in nearby Modena, has a passion for Italian food, and spent the last ten years touring Italy/Europe as a pro musician before settling in Bologna to work in advertising. He loves sports, especially surfing when we can stay by the ocean.

We really enjoy living in Bologna, scootering through the appenine backcountry, exploring the medieval fortresses, and beautiful Bolognese streets at night. For us it will always be the romantic Italian city where we met and married, and we love to help visitors discover the hidden secrets of this often overlooked gem of a city, and surrounding areas.

We have three guest rooms at the front of the house are set up to be cosy retreats with a nice view while traveling in Italy. It is possible to come and go independently, or if you‚Äôre feeling social our common kitchen is a happy place to share a glass of wine or cappuccino, some chats and a taste of Italy for any travelers who would appreciate a local welcome with a flavor of home.

name: Santo Stefano Square
description:
Gorgeous apartment located in the most beautiful square of Italy, Piazza Santo Stefano

Our multilingual and qualified staff, will offer you the best welcome to Bologna, offering suggestions and assistance about local services, cultural events and festivals, public transports, tours, restaurants, inns and pubs, monuments and museums, walking and bike touring on the famous hills of Bologna.
neighborhood_overview:
the S.Stefano neighborhood is one of the characteristic views of the historic center of Bologna. Coming from the Two Towers, the opposite front of the square is closed by the Basilica di Santo Stefano complex, or the Seven Churches.

The square, often used for cultural events and concerts, is surrounded by important buildings. Looking at the Basilica, on the left we have the complex of Isolani palaces composed of the already Lupari and Bolognini palaces, purchased and joined at different times by the Isolani family. On the right, however, there is the Palazzo Bolognini Amorini Salina, famous for its terracotta-headed frieze, and a row of 15th century merchant houses, which belonged in different moments to the Beccadelli families, then Bovi and Tacconi. On the left side you can reach Strada Maggiore through the Corte Isolani passage.

name: Casa Zanardi 2.0
description: Casa Zanardi  is more than a home! It's a place to live where you'll find a lot of harmony, diversity, and the joy of being together.
neighborhood_overview:
Nearby there are several parks with children's games, where you can relax on sunny days. In 10 minutes you can walk to the Science Museum. Below the house is one of the best pizzerias in Bologna, a pharmacy (if needed), a tobacco shop, a supermarket and various restaurants. The old town is only a 15-minute drive/bus ride away, and the bus stop is right below the house. You can also get there in 20 minutes by bike maximum.

Bologna is located in the center of Italy and is well connected to other renowned tourist destinations. By train
Florence, in 30 minutes;
Milan, in 1 hour;
Venice, in 1 hour and a half;
Rome, in 2 hours.
The sea is also about an hour away by car.

The city is known for its very active social life and for being on a human scale with its many green areas, bike paths, good food, cultural offerings and relaxed air that you can breathe.
host_about: I love to travel, meet new people and discover the world also through the people I meet and host in the house. I also love cooking and its diversity, good music and green spaces. I'm more than happy to welcome you in our nest :-)

The Bolognina neighbourhood, quiet and characteristic, with various venues including outdoors. Located right behind the Central Station and therefore convenient for reaching every place in Bologna. The largest covered square in Europe, named after the great Lucio Dalla, is very beautiful and characteristic. Here you will have a huge covered space with a bar and where concerts and live shows are often organised.

- Liber Paradisus Square (Municipality Offices);

Bologna Central Station is 2 km away and Bologna's Guglielmo Marconi Airport is 10 km from the Central Suite.

name: The mid century house
description:
Experience the true atmosphere of a traditional mid century italian house, a stone's throw from the historic centre.
Located in San Donato, a neighbourhood rich in underground clubs and history, a 10minute walk from the fair and the historic centre, this house is perfect for both workers and travellers.
Only me and my beloved dog Buio live in the house.

The house has free and paid parking available.
Pick-up service from the airport & station and tourist itineraries are available.
Info in DM.
neighborhood_overview: San Donato is one of Bologna's historic neighbourhoods, still inhabited by residents and full of nightclubs with a wide range of music from electronic to punk to jazz. Here you will find record shops, restaurants, many green areas and the tranquillity of the neighbourhood.
host_about:
Ciao! I am Andrea and I have lived in Bologna since 2007, the year I moved here to study. To date, this is my City, which I have experienced to the full in every corner. 

It will be a pleasure for me to take you to discover this remarkable town and its idyllic surroundings: unknown places, traditional trattorias, nightclubs, museum and nature trips! 

Contact me for all the details!
*
*

description:
Experience modern comfort and convenience at Due Agosto Suites in Bologna. This suite, just minutes from Bologna Centrale Station, features an ensuite bathroom, fridge, coffee machine, and stylish amenities. Perfect for a comfortable and convenient stay with self-check-in and street parking available.
Proudly part of Homeby's collection, this accommodation is lovingly managed by our team, ensuring it maintains its authentic charm.
neighborhood_overview: Due Agosto Suites is located just outside the Limited Traffic Zone (ZTL), next to Bologna Centrale Station, making it an ideal base for exploring the city. The vibrant neighborhood of Bolognina offers a blend of cultural richness and modern conveniences. You'll be within walking distance of historical landmarks such as Piazza Maggiore, Le Due Torri (Asinelli and Garisenda Towers), and the Basilica di San Petronio. Discover the academic atmosphere at the University of Bologna and explore the Archiginnasio of Bologna. For a taste of local life, visit the Mercato Bolognina or the Quadrilatero Market, known for its fresh produce and Bolognese cuisine, including the famous Tagliatelle al Rag√π. Art enthusiasts will appreciate the nearby MAMbo (Museum of Modern Art of Bologna). The neighborhood is perfect for evening strolls, where you can immerse yourself in the lively atmosphere and discover local gems. Whether you're here for the sights, the food, or the culture, Due Agosto Suites offers a
host_about:
Each property we manage holds a special place in our hearts, ready to reveal its unique story to you.

Whether traveling for leisure or business, we craft memorable stays and ensure the services and support you need.

We look forward to welcoming you soon!
